p: The plant material used in the experiment was diversified in terms of botanical origin as well as morphology: flowers of lavender Lavandula angustifolia Mill. (Flos, Poland), leaves of sage Salvia officinalis L. (Flos, Poland), fruits of caraway Carum carvi L. (Kawon, Poland), leaves of peppermint Mentha Ã— piperita L.(Flos, Poland); dried chamomile flowers Matricaria chamomilla L. (Flos, Poland), fruits of fennel Foeniculum capillaceum Gilib. (Kawon, Poland). Herbs from a single production batch were purchased from a pharmacy. The plant material was standardised through pooling together and fragmentation of a homogeneous fraction, after which the moisture level of each product was measured for conversion to dry matter.
